page.title: 02Land use
page.content:
Although much of the area is common land there are large areas taken up with the{Mental Hospitals}of West Park and The Manor.
Farming is also very important with { {Rushett Farm} occupying some 800 acres.
Large {housing estates}on the edges of Epsom and Ashtead grew up in the 1930's and 1940's to provide homes in the country for London's{Commuters.}
Much of the {woodland}was used in the past for shipbuilding but now the demand has gone and the forrests have been left to grow wild. Some areas are used for leisure with a large golf course to the north of Leatherhead.
